• Food safety an food security: self-control, traceability, materials in contact with food, CAP 
opportunities , food transport, Agricultural product quality policy both at European that 
Community-led local development strategy level. 
• Labeling and promoting: study of the content posted on the label and on nutrition labeling not 
only on the basis of existing legislation, but also for improve the communication of agrifood 
identity; 
• Environmental labeling: clarification on the information to be included on the packaging for 
proper collection by the end user, facilitating the process of reuse, recovery and recycling of 
packaging and packaging waste; 
• Education for healthy diet: just as strategic, as required by European regulations on food 
safety, it is the duty of communication to consumers on the risks that certain foods can have for 
certain groups of people, on the impact on health of a diet inappropriate.

goals__remit:
THE ITALIAN FOOD TECHNOLOGISTS BOARD 
(www.tecnologialimentari.it) 
The Food Technologists Board (FTB) is a public no-profit agency ruled by Italian law 
n°59/1994 (Rules governing the professional practice) that regulates, among others, the 
specific professional skills, as well as their updating, needed for the professional practice. 
The graduated (MD) in FS&T pass the State examination, and enroll in the board to pursue 
independently the career of Food Technologist. All members are required to comply with 
the Code of Professional Conduct. 
The Italian Food Technologists Board is organized in Regional Chapters. The members of 
the Regional Chapters participate in the election of the National Council of the Food 
Technologists Board (NCFTB), which has National responsibilities, in particular: 
 expresses, when requested by the Minister of Justice, its opinion on draft laws and 
regulations regarding the profession; 
 appoints its representatives on committees or organizations at national or 
international level; 
 ensures compliance with the rules governing the Food Technologists profession; 
 carries out activities aimed at the suppression of the unauthorized exercise of the 
profession; 
 designates Food Technologists to compose the commission of the State 
examination; 
 promotes and facilitates the technical and cultural development of its members. 
Furthermore, the NCFTB facilitates the networking among members and stakeholders, such 
as universities, private companies and public institutions.
